Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.
Agreed, and I regret not doing it for a friend before hand
Is it the weekend already?

I use to run a doggy daycare and boarding facility

My friend brought her dogs 3-4 times a week. She would pay normal daycare fees. But I would not allow her to pay the kennel fee ($15 per dog more) I would just tell her that it's the same fee as daycare 

For her wedding gift I gave her 4 nights free for over ight boarding
The majority of the time your friends are mlm shilling so big nope. But if it's a legit small business then sure.

I hate this one...I started a small business and the first thing you heard from friends is what kind of discount you will offer. I would never do that that's not only rude thats not being a good friend.
my friend owns a multi million dollar pizza franchise, i cant get free pizza?

I just laid turf and I have no idea how to take great care of it so I called up a mate who is a greens man at the local golf course

Asked him to come by and asked if he'd be willing to take care of my lawn for me, give it the deluxe treatment 

He agreed and tried to charge me a ridiculous price, way too low, I explained to him he was doing me a favour by taking good care of it and I didnt need special cheap pricing and for him to charge what he's actually worth. He kept low balling himself so I asked what he gets from his work, told him id pay the same and then some on top for giving up his free time for me.

I also will cook up bbqs for him and give him beers when he's working, when he was digging out clay I made sure to be out there with the shovel working too.

In return he's done a bloody great job, comes by twice a week and really takes care of everything.

Pay people what they're worth, and if you consider them a friend, pay them extra.

In return they will do a good job, or even go the extra mile for you.

My uncle owns a restaurant. Every time I go there and he or my aunt are there, my food is free. So I usually try to go there when neither of them are around. I love that they want to provide us food for free, but I just want to support them.

I work for a guy who owns his own general contracting business. He says he never does work for friends because they *always* expect some discount or free work. Giving someone a “friendly discount” is losing him time he could be spending on an actual job and costing him money. A good friend wouldn’t do that do another friend.
Side note. If you friend is a doctor, accountant or lawyer don’t ask for free advice. You are the asshole.
Why do I feel like I keep seeing this tip
I own a business and that’s pretty much what I get every time some one I know asks for anything. The best ones are people I don’t even know personally but know someone that knows me lol.

I own a small business and my friends have never asked for a discount.  I give them one.  But at least here in KY I think it’s more the other way around - give your friends a discount because they aren’t going to ask for one like some punk ass bitch

As a business owner if I'm charging you for my services we are not friends. You might be a good acquaintance, a bar friend, friend of a friends friend....but youre not my friend. 

If you were my friend we would have completed whatever together because you spent a week plotting with my wife and got all the material ready and had  my wife call to come over for some pizza with everyone after work. So I get there and youre standing in the driveway next to the material smiling holding a slice of pizza while the kids are playing and I realize that I have been tricked into working more and i have a smile on my face.
How many times is this going to be posted here?
This is a good one. Thank you!

Second best way is to support is on social media. 

Like, comment and share their posts! Recommend to anyone asking on social media's.
More like an opinion rather than a tip
Just sold and bought a house. Our friend happens to be a really good realtor. It was tough paying out so much $ but she was definitely worth it!
I call bullshit. It's only natural for friends to do favors for each other. Ask for a discount if you want. If your friend says no, it's no big deal.

"It costs that much 'cause it takes me f*cking hours (f*cking hours)
It costs that much 'cause I don't have super powers (super powers)
You need to pay for my skills 'cause exposure doesn't pay the bills
It costs that much 'cause it takes me f*cking hours"

this is such a bullshit. you will do a lot of advertizing for your friend and will in best case get him or her some extrabusiness. also discounted products do not cost a company the retail price.if you get a product that would cost you 100 for 70, it might have cost your friend only 50.
Unless said friend works for Herbalife, in that case don't buy anything and unfriend them.

I actually paid my friend double what she asked for for some bespoke wood burning signs. As did the other two people who bought her stuff through me. Support your friends, especially when they are getting started!!
Sidenote: MLM is NOT your friend's business, don't support that junk at all
This has been posted Verbatim all the time in this subreddit. Originality is fucking dead, buried, and turned into a tree on this website.
I charge everyone the “friends and family” price. Everyone seems happy.

"do i get the friend discount?"

"why? do you want to pay me more?"

~ stepfather of my mother
